loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Inti, tiene 48 años, es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven con ella, es conviviente, tiene mas de 1 año como socia en FINCA Perú, se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y menor, por ahora esta mejorando en su negocio, le va muy bien, también esta educando a sus hijos, le gusta las capacitaciones, las que pone en práctica con su familia y también en su negocio como ahorrar, distribuir sus ganancias e invertir. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de frutas de la costa como por ejemplo sandias para vender en el mercado.
texts.en: Salome is a member of the Inti Communal Bank. She is 48 years old, she lives with her life partner, she is the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom live with her, and she has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 1 year. She is a retailer and she sells fruits. She is currently improving her activity and things are going well; she is also educating her children, as she likes the seminars and she puts them into practice with her family as well as with her activity by saving, subdividing her earnings and investing. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her activity by buying fruits from the coast such as watermelons to sell them in the market.

loans.use: To buy watermelons at wholesale price.

loans.name: Leda Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Leda , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , su esposo labora para una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ella desde hace dos años  trabaja como mesera , para poder salir hacia adelante ; ya que tienen hijos que estudian , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sobre todo construir una casa digna , ya que su actual vivienda es de zinc , plástico y algunos pedazo de madera , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de bloques , arena , piedras , hierro ,entre otros productos para realizar las construcción , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva para poder mejor su calidad de vida .
texts.en: Leda is an inhabitant of the municipality Ticuantepe, together with her family. Her husband works for a private business in order the support their household expenses. For 2 years she has worked as a waitress in order to be able to move forward, since they have children that study. The future plans are to improve their living conditions and above all construct a decent house, as their current housing is made of zinc, plastic and some pieces of wood. The financing that she wants is to purchase blocks, sand, stones, and iron, among other products for the construction. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic provides through Kiva funds in order for her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ana Aurora

texts.es:
Ana es una persona tranquila, pacífica y le encanta su trabajo es muy responsable en las actividades que tiene que realizar diariamente. Ana es madre soltera, vive con su hija de 15 años en Machachi que se encuentra a 45 minutos de Latacunga.

Ana trabaja en un puesto de venta de asados como: asados de cuy, gallina entre otros. Ana trabaja con Fodemi por un tiempod e tres años, el crédito actual va a invertir en la adecuación de su puesto de ventas y también para la compra de cuyes, gallinas, cerdos para incrementar su negocio y para generar mayires ventas que ayudarán a mantener a su hija y darle lo que nesecita para el estudio.

El sueño de Ana es poder tener un restaurant propio para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is a calm, peaceful person who loves her work. She is very responsible in the activities which she has to carry out every day. Ana is a single mother. She lives with her 15-year-old daughter in Machachi, which is located 45 minutes from Latacunga.

Ana works in a stand where she sells roasted meat such as guinea pig and chicken, among others. Ana has worked with Fodemi for a period of three years. She is going to invest the present loan in equipping her sales stand and also in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs to enlarge her business and generate more sales, which will help her to support her daughter and give her what she needs for school.

Ana's dream is to be able to have her own restaurant to generate more income.

loans.use: to equip her sales stall and to buy guinea pigs and chickens to roast

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: Harold  conforma una familia con su cónyuge y 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 27 años en el municipio de Soledad, donde vende víveres y abarrotes; artículos que compra para surtir tiendas y pequeños negocios,  que venden principalmente a las amas de casa. Él inició esta actividad  hace 3 años, cuando empezó vendiendo útiles de aseo personal y gradualmente su negocio empezó a crecer;  hoy ha agregado productos de la canasta familiar como arroz, aceite, embutidos enlatados etc.  Harold vende mediante el sistema de crédito corto, el entrega la mercancía a sus clientes,  y recupera  su dinero al día siguiente. Sus compras la realiza de contado y diariamente en graneros de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ubicada a 20 minutos de la población donde habita. Cada vez que su clientela crece,  se da cuenta que su capital de trabajo, se torna insuficiente para responde a una demanda de manera oportuna. Esta es la razón por la cual está  aplicando a Kiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará víveres y abarrotes en mayor cantidad, con ello aprovecharía los descuentos por más volumen y generaría mas utilidades que impactarían positivamente su negocio y aumentarían sus ingresos, con los que sostiene a su familia.
texts.en: Harold's family consists of his wife and four children who are between 19 and 27 years old.  They live in the town of Soledad and this is where Harold sells food products and groceries.  He buys these products to supply stores and small businesses who mainly sell to housewives.  Harold started this business three years ago when he started selling toiletries.  His business gradually started to grow and he has now added household essentials such as rice, oil, cold cuts, canned food, etc. to his sales.  Harold sells on a short-term credit system.  He delivers his merchandise to his customers and collects payment the next day.  He makes his purchases for cash every day in grocery stores in the city of Barranquilla, which is 20 minutes from his town.  Each time his customer base grows, he realizes that his working capital is not enough to respond to his demand in a timely manner.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan (his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  He will use his loan to buy food products and groceries in larger quantities.  This means he will be able to make the most of bulk discounts and make more profits.  This will have a positive impact on his business and increase his income which he uses to support his family.

loans.use: to buy food products and groceries in larger quantities

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She operates a food stall, and has been in this business for four years. She is 26 years old, married, and has one child, who is not in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.  This is her first loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase onions & tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 54 años de edad, está casado con Alejandra de 54 años, fruto de este amor tienen 7 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia que esta ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Alejandro, es un hombre  trabajador, que se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cacao y café sobre su propia parcela. En un inicio, atrevasaba una crisis económica pero el deseo de superarse lo llevo a incursionar a esta actividad. 
Generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su querida esposa, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre cuenta con peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos para luego pasar por el secadero y finalmente ponerlo en venta. Alejandro esta contento con lo que realiza pues gracias a ello paga la educación, alimentación y vestido de sus hijos. Más adelante esta pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de obtener otros ingresos. Por tanto éste será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que obtendra contratará peones para que realicen el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 54, is married to 54 year old Alejandra.  They have seven children.  They live together in their own house in the Periavente Alta community of the Llochequa district.  Alejandro is a hard-working man who devotes himself to growing cacao and coffee on his own parcel of land.  In the beginning he went through a financial crisis.  However, his desire to improve caused him to take on this business activity.

He generally works with the help of his beloved wife.  However, during harvest times he always has help from day workers who facilitate the extraction of his products.  The products later go through a machine that dries them, and they are finally put up for sale.  

Alejandro is happy with what he does.  Thanks to his business activity he pays for education, food, and clothing for his children.  He is thinking of opening a grocery store later in order to get other income.

This will be his second loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 3,000 soles to hire day workers to perform maintenance on his cacao and coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades de los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y de ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la señora Lisia vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti y también tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y vio una gran oportunidad de progreso en la ayuda de la fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, panificados, lácteos y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo como microempresaria y darle más variedad a los clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the Mujeres Activas Communal Bank are from the city of Caacupé. They are very hardworking people who are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, thanks to the ease of obtaining loans, they can invest in their businesses or start a new one.

The president, Sra. Lisia, lives with her husband and children. She does ñanduti [fine Paraguayan lace] crafts work and also has a small store in her house. She and the other members constantly engage in their businesses and promote mutual integration and try to make their payments early. She is a very resourceful and hardworking woman and saw a great opportunity to progress with the help of the Fundación.

She is requesting this loan to purchase drinks, food, baked goods, dairy products and other items so that she will be able to continue growing as a small business and provide a more varied inventory to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, baked goods, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a 43 year old lady from Homabay town, in western Kenya.  She is married to Josiah, and has four children aged 8,14,16 and 18 years.

Sophy operates a green grocer business, selling green vegetables and other foodstuffs.  She has been in this business for the last 11 years, and earns a monthly income of  KES 17,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of tomatoes, mangoes and onions.  She will use her profits to increase her business’ capital base.  Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, mangoes and onions.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 24 years of age, married, and blessed with two children, aged six and two years respectively. She is a hawker, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to buy tea leaves, bananas, and packets of sweets and biscuits for sale. The profits will help her expand her business. Her dream is to be successful in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, bananas, and packets of sweets and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Matenneh

texts.en: Matenneh lives in Jacob Town, Liberia.  She is 32 years old and married.  Her husband is a carpenter.  They have three children between the ages of 7 and 10 years old.  For the past five years, she has been selling rubber dishes in the market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.  Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Kathorina

texts.en:
Kathorina is a 59-year-old lady from Migori town and is married to Gabriel.  They have five grownup children.

Kathorina operates a cereal selling business, a business she has been doing for the last six years, making a monthly income of KES 14,000.  She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy rice, maize and bean cereals.

Her dream is to have a better standard of living and to help educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50 year old businesswoman.  She is married to Wilson, a businessman. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

Nancy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruit for her business. The anticipated profits from the business will go toward the education of her children. She dreams of distributing greens to nearby schools and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruit for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man.  He lives with his wife and five working children.  They are all working together in order to enhance their way of living.  Ali started as a construction worker in 1981.  He works independently on a freelance basis and looks forward to taking on more projects. 

Today, he is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed construction tools and supplies for his business.  This loan will improve his business and allow him earn superior income.  In the future, he plans to take on new projects and attract added customers.

loans.use: purchase tools and supplies for his construction business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando. Es empleado de una compañía como vendedor, es el único que trabaja para mantener a si familia y darles lo mejor. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene un problema familiar de salud de un sobrino de pequeña edad que necesita una opresión y desea ayudar a su hermana  para que puedan realizar la cirugía lo más pronto posible. 
Don francisco Javier espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito y así podrá ayudar a su familiar. Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is the father of three children who are still studying. He is a vendor for a company, and he is the only one of his family to have a job, therefore working to provide for his family and for himself.
He is requesting a loan because there has been a health problem in his family: a young nephew needs to be operated, and Francisco wants to help his sister so that the child can undergo surgery as soon as possible.
Francisco Javier hopes to be able to count on your support with this loan, so that he will succeed in helping his sister. He plans on repaying the loan with a part of the salary he earns with his job.

loans.use: To help his sister paying for surgery for her child.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Рахмат более 25 лет занимается животноводством. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы и телят.
texts.en: Rahmat has been in animal husbandry for more than 25 years.  He is 54 years old.  He is married and has five children.  Rahmat is taking out the loan to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.use: to buy a cow and calves.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий женат, имеет двоих детей. Юрий вырос в селе и с детства знает что такое ферма. Вот уже 10 лет, как он занимается фермерством самостоятельно – выращивает овощи в тепличных условиях. На данный момент у него есть четыре теплицы для овощей и две для рассады. Данный бизнес очень перспективен для региона, так как есть оптовый рынок сбыта.

Основные затраты приходятся на закупку семян, а также новую пленку для теплиц, которую нужно менять не реже, чем раз в два года. Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен, что поможет ему закупить семена и пленку. Юрий планирует расширять свой бизнес дальше, так как у него есть еще не занятая земля. Также он планирует приобрести новый автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Yuriy is married and has two children. Yuriy grew up in the village and knows what a farm is since his childhood. He has been in the farming business for ten years now – he grows vegetables in the greenhouses. At this time he has four greenhouses for vegetables and two for seedlings. This business is very profitable for this region because there's a wholesale market.

Main business expenses go towards buying of seeds and new film for the greenhouses which has to be changed not less than once in two years. Yuriy is asking to provide him a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnas which will help him buy seeds and film. Yuriy plans to expand his business further as he has a vacant plot of land. He also plans to buy a new car for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plastic film for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Yader Alexander

texts.es: Yader Alexander es un emprendedor que se le ha  apoyado en el financiamiento en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los trofeos que él elabora para sus clientes que le solicitan frecuentemente lo visitan ya tiene varios pedidos pendiente. El negocio que emprendió es muy demandado por sus clientes y el está enamorado de su negocio que le brinda mucho empeño y dedicación. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de plata, cintas, medallas, entre otros productos para la elaboración de  los trofeos.
texts.en: Yader Alexander is an entrepreneur who has received a loan to buy materials to produce the trophies he creates for his customers, who frequently visit him, and he already has many pending orders. The service he offers is very requested by his customers, and he is in love with his activity, to which he dedicated a lot of time and a deep passion. He is currently requesting a loan to buy silver, ribbons, medals and other products to create trophies.

loans.use: To buy silver, ribbons and medals to crete trophies.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 48 años vive con su esposa y tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 10 años respectivamente.   Soledad,  es un municipio cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí  es donde habita y tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas, el cual  inició hace 3 años, de manera ambulante en una esquina de la avenida principal;  su buena organización y esmero en su trabajo,  lo ayudaron para que posteriormente alquilara un local cuando estuvo posicionado con su clientela, gradualmente logró crecer y comprar equipos, herramientas y  este crecimiento reflejado en nueva clientela, ha exigido que sea apoyado por su esposa y por dos empleados como en la actualidad trabaja. Hoy se encuentra  aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como mantequilla, salsas y otros insumos en mayor proporción, para ganar descuentos y principalmente prepararse para una de las épocas en la cual su negocio vende mucho más. “Los Carnavales. “ Su mayor desafío es tener su casa propia, por eso todos los días vive entusiasmado en trabajar,  porque tiene como meta lograr este propósito y generar mayor bienestar  a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 48, lives with his wife and has two children, ages one and ten.  Soledad is a municipality close to the city of Barranquilla.  That is where he lives and where he has his fast food business.  He started the business three years ago by selling in an itinerant manner on a corner of a main street.  His good organization and dedication to his work helped him to later rent a place while he was establishing himself with his customers. 

He gradually managed to grow and buy equipment and tools.  With this growth came new customers, and it necessitated the support of his wife and two employees who currently work for him.

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy ingredients like butter, salsas, and other supplies in greater amounts in order to get discounts.  He will be especially preparing for the season,  “Los Carnavales”,  when his business sells a lot more.

His greatest challenge is to have his own house.  That is why every day he works enthusiastically; he wants to achieve this goal and create greater well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like butter, salsas, and other supplies in greater amounts in order to get discounts.

loans.name: Dolores Del Pilar

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad quienes están con educación primaria, tiene casa propia en la cual vive junto a su familia, su casa esta ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “CP-2 Hualtaco II” del distrito de Tambogrande, a un corto tiempo de la Provincia de Piura.

Su actividad económica a la que Dolores se dedica es la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales como ganado vacuno, ovinos y aves de corral; los cría y engorda hasta que alcancen el tamaño y peso ideal para ofrecerlos en el mercado local o en clientes de las afueras de su caserío.
Su conyugue es agricultor desde muy pequeño por lo que ahora cuenta con una parcela en la que ha sembrado mango y limón. Adicionalmente ellos también se generan otros ingresos trabajando para una fábrica durante las campañas que se presente.

Dolores desea utilizar el crédito que esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales los cuales quiere darle el tamaño y peso ideal para su próxima venta. Pues esta dispuesta a seguir creciendo en sus negocios para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida y por ende una mejor educación para sus hijos
texts.en:
Dolores is 33 years old, married, and has three dependent children who are in elementary school.  She owns her own home and lives there with her family.  Her house is located in a rural village called "CP-2 Hualtaco II", in Tambogrande district, a short distance from Piura province.

Dolores' business activity is raising and selling animals such as cows, sheep and farmyard birds.  She raises these animals and fattens them until they reach an ideal size and weight.  She then sells them in the local market or to customers who live on the outskirts of her village.

Dolores' husband has been farming since he was young.  He now has a plot of land on which he grows mangoes and lemons.  They also make additional income working in a factory.

Dolores would like to use this loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals as she would like them to reach an ideal size and weight so that she can sell them.  She is ready to continue growing in her business so that she can achieve a better quality of life and a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет высшее образование. По профессии он преподаватель. В этой области он не работает. Рустам открыл продуктовый магазин, где работает продавцом. Торговлей он занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the town of Kulob. He is 30 years old, married and has five children. He has higher education and is a teacher by profession. He does not work in this field. Rustam has opened a grocery store where he works as a salesperson. He has been selling for sixteen years. He is taking out the loan to increase commodity circulation.

loans.use: to purchase necessary groceries.

loans.name: El Guanacaste Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guanacaste está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Reyna Elizabeth quien vende ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y plata desde hace 2 ½ años. Ella es casada y tiene dos niños de 7 y 2 años de edad y su meta es aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Erika se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes, Verónica quien tiene una comideria y Blanca tiene una pulpería y comideria.

(La foto fue tomada mientras estaban en la capacitacion de Educación Financiera.)
texts.en:
The Guanacaste group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising women. The group coordinator is the young Reyna Elizabeth, who has sold clothing, cosmetics, perfume and silver for two and a half years. She is married and has two children ages 2 and 7. Her goal is to expand her business.
The other group members are Erika, who sells clothing and perfume; Veronica, who runs an eatery; and Blanca, who has a convenience store and an eatery.
(The photo was taken while the members were at a financial education training session).

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfume and silver.

loans.name: Sop Nabi/ Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Nabi/Deggo est créé depuis le 9 juillet 2011, il est composé de dix sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier et leur activité principale est le commerce.
Madame Seynabou est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée mère de cinq enfants et a en charge le fils d'un ami de son mari. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaires avec une très bonne expérience de plus de 20 ans. Elle est debout habillée en jaune avec une écharpe noire-dorée autour des épaules et a levé la main droite. 

Elle achète de l'huile de palme, du miel et des bonbons qu'elle revend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui servira à s'approvisionner en quantité afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle appui son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille pour la nourriture et la santé; souhaite renforcer son activité et constituer une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
The 'Sop Nabi/Deggo' community bank was formed on July 9th, 2011.  It has 17 members (all women) who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Seynabou is 50 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She also cares for the son of one of her husband's friends.  Her business is selling food products and she has good experience (more than 20 years worth).  In the photo, Seynabou is standing.  She is dressed in yellow, with a gold / black scarf round her shoulders.  She is raising her right hand.

Seynabou will buy palm oil, honey and candies with her loan.  She will resell these products in the town's central market.

Seynabou's loan will help her to stock her business so that she can make a lot of profit.  She supports her husband in managing their family expenses on food and health.  She hopes to strengthen her business and make good savings.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Mohamed Aïdara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Mohamed Aïdara existe depuis le 7 juillet 2011; il est composé de neuf femmes qui ont pour lien commun le petit commerce et elles habitent le même quartier.




Faguéye la responsable du groupe est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants et a en charge son petit fils ( enfant de sa nièce). Elle tisse des nattes depuis plus de 15 ans,et fait de l'embouche aussi; elle a une bonne expérience. Elle a rejoint le banc villageois au cycle 2 et a remplacé l'ancienne responsable qui a démissionné;sur la photo elle est debout à l'extrême habillée en blanc vert avec un pull noir et a levé la main droite

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des moutons au marché hebdomadaire pour embouche et à revendre après 4 ou 5 mois pour se faire de bons revenus avant le remboursement.


Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour aider son mari. Elle souhaite également constituer son épargne avec les bénéfices obtenus.
texts.en:
The 'Mohamed Aïdara' community bank was formed on July 7th, 2011.  The group has nine female members whose common link is small business and the fact that they live in the same neighborhood.

Faguéye is the group's leader.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She also cares for her great nephew (the child of her niece).  She has been weaving mats for 15 years.  She also raises animals and has a lot of experience.  Faguéye joined her community bank during their second loan cycle and replaced the previous head of the bank who resigned.  She is standing on the far right in the photo.  She is dressed in white and green and is wearing a black sweater.  She is raising her right hand.

Faguéye's loan will be used to buy sheep in the weekly market.  She will resell them after 4 or 5 months and make good profits before her repayment is due.

Faguéye contributes towards her family expenses in order to help her husband.  She hopes to add to her savings with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 51-year-old lady who is married to Daud, a 60-year-old man. They are blessed with four children.  Dince, 28, is married.  Yunita, 26 and Yanti, 24, are working. Mery is 22. 

Even though her children are grown up, married and working, Lisa prefers to spend her days doing some activities besides being a housewife. Fortunately, Lisa has a hobby baking cakes so she decided to commence a business selling cakes i.e. fried banana, donut, fried bread, and onde – onde (made from cassava, rasp coconut and palm sugar). Every day she wakes up early in the morning to make the cakes. Then she sells them from 7:00 am until 12:00 pm.
 
Lisa is very grateful since she has regular customers to buy her cakes, mostly her neighbors. Lisa intends to add various cakes in her business as demanded by the customers but she does not have enough money to do so. 

Lisa is seeking a loan to help her in improving her business. She heard that TLM is willing to provide loan assistance for the small business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000. This loan will be spent on wheat flour, eggs, margarine, fried oil and other ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, eggs, margarine, oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a 43-year-old lady who is married to Ayub, a 55-year-old man. They are blessed with three children. They are Alberto, 25, who graduated from Junior High School; Margareta, 20, who is married; and Olivia, 8, who is attending the second grade of Elementary School.

Agustina owns a small business selling instant food consisting of rice, chicken, fish, vegetables or noodle. She puts it in a medium plastic box per portion. The food is sold out quickly as she sells it at the harbor when the ship docks.  

Agustina was thinking of initiating another business: breeding pigs. Agustina loves her current business but there are times she cannot run her business, particularly during bad weather when there is no ship docked at the harbor. This situation impacts her income.

Agustina used to join TLM’s group lending program but she would like to get a larger loan amount through the individual lending program and therefore submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. Agustina will spend the loan to buy piglets and fodder. She really hopes that through the loan she can have a chance to start the business to get a better income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and the fodder

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is 32 years old and married with two children. He sells doughnuts to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and wheat flour

loans.name: Afansi

texts.fr:
Afansi est une femme  âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 05 enfants. 
Afansi travaille comme revendeuse de poissons fumés  depuis 1995. Elle vend seule au grand marché de Lomé et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Afansi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons fumés. elle réinvestir dans l'activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afansi is a 39-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has 5 children.  Afansi has been working as a smoked fish reseller since 1995.  She sells alone at the Grand Market in Lomé and also buys her goods in Lomé.  Afansi has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy smoked fish.  She would like to reinvest in her business and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Deira Luz

texts.es:
Deira de 35 años de edad tiene un hijo en la edad de 13 años, con el que sueña verlo convertido en un profesional exitoso. Ella es la propietaria de una sala de belleza, donde ofrece los servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional femenina, masculina e infantil. 
Su emprendimiento  nació de su aptitud frente al tema de belleza cosmética, por eso una vez terminó estudios de bachiller, realizó estudios técnicos de belleza e inició su negocio,  con un espejo, una máquina de cortar cabello y muchas ganas de triunfar; como empezó a ganar dinero en esta actividad,  lo invirtió en un secador y gradualmente ha ido agregando todo el equipamiento, como  secadores, cepillos y hasta una vitrina,  para lograr captar nuevos clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes actuales. Últimamente no solo ofrece el servicio de corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure etc.,  sino también asesorías, a través de las cuales vende productos de belleza y con ello ha logrado estabilizar su clientela.   Su meta es adicionar una nueva silla de peluquería y agregar mercancías novedosas,  para continuar ampliando la cobertura de clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará productos de belleza, tintes, para cabellos, champoo, tratamientos capilares, entre otros productos que atraen a su clientela y que tiene encargado a Deira; esta es la razón en la que fundamenta el potencial éxito de su inversión, porque lo hace sobre pedidos y su compra es de contado y en mayor volumen, ganado así descuentos.  Su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertirle a su negocia ante su creciente y exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Deira, 46, has a 13-year old son who she dreams about seeing become a successful professional.  She is the owner of a beauty shop where she offers personal and professional image improvement for women, men and children.
Her entrepreneurial spirit was born with her talent for cosmetics beautification and that is why when she finished her high school, she studied cosmetology and started her business with a mirror, a machine to cut hair and many desires to succeed.  As she started earning money with her work, she bought a dryer and gradually has been adding equipment such as dryers, brushes, and even a showcase to be able to attract new customers and satisfy the needs of the current ones.  Lately she not only offers haircuts, manicures, pedicures, etc, but also new personal accessories.  She sells beauty products and thus has been able to establish a customer base.  
Her goal is to add a new chair for haircuts and increase her merchandise to continue attracting customers.
Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first that she has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy beauty products, hair dyes, shampoo, hair treatments, etc to bring in more customers that order from her.  That is why she sees the potential success of her investment because she takes orders and buys on credit.  With a higher volume, she will get discounts.  Her greatest goal is to have enough working capital to invest in her business which has increasing and demanding customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair dyes, shampoo,hair treatments, etc, that attract customers

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 17 and 9 years, respectively. She owns a grocery store, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, beans and maize to sell. The profit she earns from it will help her purchase a motorcycle. Her dream is to buy land and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He’s the main income provider in his family and is searching to offer them a fair way of living. He has been working in the construction field since year 2000, independently. He’s specialized in stone coating, and well known for his professionalism at work. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy added supplies for his business such as stones. Definitely, this Kiva loan will develop his work and therefore increase his earnings. In the future, he plans to improve his work and better support his family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for his business such as stones

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

Fortunata sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. 

Fortunata continúa vendiendo artesanía en la puerta de los hoteles, en la Plaza de Armas y en los monumentos arqueológicos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella sigue ofreciendo a los turistas chompas, chalinas, guantes de material de lana de alpaca y llama. Ya son 32 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Fortunata es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía saca adelante a sus hijos. Fortunata con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar más  chalinas, chompas y guantes de lana.
texts.en:
Fortunata is still a member of the communal bank "INTI" in the Asociación Arariwa, located in the department of Cusco, Peru.  This communal bank is in its 3rd year of working together, and all of the members are doing very well.  (Inti is a word in the Quechua language that means "Sun.")

Fortunata continues to live in the historic city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, Peru.  In Cusco, people work in a variety of different businesses and provide a variety of services, but much of this economic activity is related to tourism. 

Fortunata is still selling handicrafts at the entrance of hotels, in the main plaza (the Plaza de Armas), and at the archaeological monuments in the city of Cusco.  She continues to offer the tourists sweaters, scarves and gloves that are made from alpaca and llama wool.  She has had this business for 32 years, and it has gone very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Fortunata is a tenacious and hardworking woman who, with her small handicraft business, is getting ahead with her children.  With the last loan, things went very well for Fortunata and she was able to increase her income.  At this time, Fortunata needs a loan to buy more wool scarves, sweaters and gloves.

loans.use: Purchase woolen articles such as sweaters, scarves, and gloves

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 45 years old from Vihiga and married to John. They have four school-going children. 

Naomi has operated a tailoring business for the last 12 years and the business gives her a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textile materials worth KES 13,000. She will use her profits to provide the family’s basic needs.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a stock of textile materials

loans.name: Kuwirirana 5 Group

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Janet from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, both attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Janet runs a business selling clothing. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Janet has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance the family's welfare. In the future, Janet plans to open a clothing shop in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 32-year-old man from Rodi Kopany in Homabay. He and his wife Everlyne have three children aged between two and five years.

George has operated a retail shop for the last two years and makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat. He will channel his profits into expanding his retail shop.

His dream is to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store like sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and married with two children. She runs a cereals shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Margaret has been able to save her income, and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 30,000 KES to buy three sacks of maize, two sacks of beans, and two sacks of rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Kubo

texts.en: Kubo lives in Jacob Town. She is 36 years old, married and her husband is a driver. They have five children 10 to 16 years old. For the past 20 years, she has been selling vita oil, season oil, and back pepper in the market. She started this business with her savings and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita oil, season oil, and black pepper for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vita oil, season oil, and black pepper for her business

loans.name: Las Colmenas 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Yanna is the group coordinator of Las Colmenas. Her group is located in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic and is composed of 15 micro-entrepreuners. She lives in a simple home structure with her two children and her long-term partner. Yanna said her most difficult challenge has been to complete her university studies and raise and educate her children. She enjoys ironing their clothes.

This is Yanna's sixth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza International, around three years ago. She plans to use this loan to purchase a glass cabinet and different pairs of shoes. This cabinet will be used to show her products. 

Yanna wants to reinvest the profits from her business and to save because her future plan is to improve her family's living conditions, have enough money to provide a good education for her children, and send them to university. She hopes to be able to save enough money to continue improving her family's lives and to make one of her dreams come true, her dream of having a successful business. She thanks you for your support! There are two photos to make visible as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy a glass cabinet and shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 34-year-old man from Migori town. He and his wife Caroline have five children, aged three, five, seven, ten, and thirteen.

John has operated a pharmacy for the last 10 years, and he makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy medicines to sell in his pharmacy. He will use his expected profits to improve his family’s living standards.

John's dream is to stabilize his business so that his income is high enough to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy medicines to dispense.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children, one of whom is working, while the other is still attending school. Diaa's husband has been working at the municipality for the past four years. As for Diaa, she started to work as a tailor from her home in 2001 and already has 15 years of experience in this domain. With the cooperation of her husband, Diaa has been able to provide for her family's needs and pay her child’s school fees. 

Today, Diaa wants to borrow funds from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new tailoring machine and textiles, which will allow her to increase her production and, thus, her profits. In the future, Diaa plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and textiles.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in Malindi, Kenya. She owns a café that has now been in operation for four years. 

After learning about Milango from her friends, Rael is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase raw materials like sugar and flour. 

In order to overcome challenges like taxes and the high cost of materials, Rael also intends to keep her café open for longer hours. Her future ambition is to have a decent restaurant in town in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like sugar and flour.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is 31 years old and married with 2 children. He does welding to earn a living. He has been in this business for seven years and has employed two people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Apollo has been able to save his income, and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 80,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Sauda, who is in her mid-30s, is married with two sons who are still going to school.  She has been running a fruit business for five years now. She works from 10 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more fruits to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to improve her daily life.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Nissan," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a 38-year-old businessman. He is married to Mary who is a farmer. They are blessed with five children. He has been selling ice cream for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Luka will use the loan to buy materials for making ice cream. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a hotel.

loans.use: to buy materials for making ice cream.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and one child who is still studying. He’s the one taking care of his family and he is  looking to enhance their way of living. Nizar has owned a natural herbs factory since 2010, where he produces and sells natural products to the neighboring areas. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of herbs and oils in order to carry on his work in a proper way. In that way, he will be able to boost his productivity and earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own natural products shop.

loans.use: to purchase herbs and oils

loans.name: Houndjiwozon

texts.fr:
Houndjiwozon est une femme âgée de 57ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur de télé-taxi. Elle a 01 enfant.  Houndjiwozon travaille comme revendeuse de boissons depuis 1992. Elle a une buvette dans laquelle elle sert  ses clients. Ses produits sont achetés à la brasserie de Lomé. Quatre personnes l’aident dans la vente de ses produits.
Houndjiwozon a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES des boissons et du SODABI (boisson locale alcoolisée faite à base de palmier à huile).
texts.en: Houndjiwozon is a 57-year-old woman.  She is married to a tele-taxi driver and has one child.  She has been working as a drink reseller since 1992.  She owns a refreshment stall where she sells drinks to her customers.  She buys her merchandise at the brewery in Lomé.  Four people help her with her business.  Houndjiwozon has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy drinks and Sodabi (West African palm wine liqueur).

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flower varieties to plant and after they mature, resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells paraffin to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy paraffin to sell.

loans.use: To buy paraffin to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy film and albums.

loans.name: Abertha

texts.en: Abertha lives in Jacob Town. She is 44 years old, married, and her husband is a security guard. They have two children aged 6 and 29 years old. For the past thirty years she has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  palm oil for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more  palm oil for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old. An enterprising business lady, she is widowed with three children. She has been selling potatoes in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Susan will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Fatoumata, célibataire, âgée de 26 ans, qui fait de la vente d’habits et de chaussures depuis  4 ans. Elle se ravitaille à Dakar et revend sa marchandise dans le quartier ou elle habite et ou elle compte la plupart de ses clients. Fatoumata n’a pas de charges car elle  vit chez son père qui  travaille toujours et gère sa famille. Ce qu’elle a comme recette ; elle le réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The borrower is named Fatoumata; she is single, 26 years old and has been selling outfits and shoes for four years. She obtains her supplies in Dakar and sells her merchandise in the neighborhood where she lives and where she sees the majority of her clients.

Fatoumata has no expenses as she lives with her father, who is still working and oversees the family. What she receives in the way of revenue, she reinvests in her business.

loans.use: To purchase outfits and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 31 years old and a business lady. She is married to John, a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged three years. Naomi has been running a beauty salon for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Naomi will use the loan to buy beauty products for her business. 


With the anticipated profit from the salon business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to add cosmetics to her salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 40 years old and married with two children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.fr:
Nicolas est un homme âgé de 54 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a cinq enfants, dont quatre à l’école. Le premier a trente ans et le dernier a quinze ans.
Nicolas travaille comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour les ménages dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Nicolas a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nicolas voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a 54-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has five children, four of whom attend school. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 15.

Nicolas has worked as a retailer since 2007. He sells general household foodstuffs in his shop. He purchases the products in Lomé. He works alone. At the moment, his primary difficulty is not being able to keep up with demand.

Nicolas has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase general foodstuffs. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Nicolas would like to expand the size of the business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Yrene

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de edad, viven en un caserío rural de nombre  “a Annape “, anexo del distrito de Morrope perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque a unos 60 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo aproximadamente. En la zona en la que viven se tienen como actividad económica principal la agricultura y la ganadería.

Maria se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, ovinos entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado ya un aproximado de 3 años, Maria desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres se ha dedicado al comercio no solamente de animales  si no que también tiene experiencia en otros productos relacionados con la agricultura
Ahora ella y su esposo tienes objetivos claros con respecto a su economía con el fin de darle una buena alimentación y buena educación por lo que se han propuesto trabajar juntos para lograrlo, su esposo esporádicamente se ayuda trabajando como obrero de campo o también se dedica a la pesca.

La zona donde vive Maria es un lugar donde constante caen lluvias, por lo que su casa esta un poco deteriorada y es por ese motivo que junto a su esposo ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles que lo emplearan en la compra de materiales de construcción para los arreglos que amerita su vivienda.
Maria y su  familia son personas de condición económica humilde pero bien educados y con buenos valores.
texts.en:
María is a 24 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and two young children in a rural hamlet called Annape, which is in the district of Morrope, province of Lambayeque, and is about 60 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  The main economic activities of the region are farming and cattle-raising.

For about three years, María has been engaged in the daily raising and subsequent marketing of poultry such as ducks and turkeys as well as guinea pigs and sheep.  Ever since she was a little girl, Maria and her parents have worked together. They have not only worked in the marketing of animals, but also have experience working with other agriculture-related products.

Now, she and her husband have clear goals with respect to their finances.  Their goals are to provide their children with good nutrition and a good education and they intend to work together to achieve these goals.  Her husband occasionally helps working as a field hand or fishing.  

In the area where Maria lives, the rain falls constantly and this has caused their house to deteriorate somewhat.  For this reason, she and her husband have decided to request a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  They will use the funds to purchase building materials for the repairs that their home deserves.  Maria and her family are people of modest economic means but they are well-educated and have good values.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for home repair.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old. An enterprising business lady, she is married to Peter, a businessman. She has been selling potatoes in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Alice will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for her business. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Jacob Town. She is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a contractor They  have three children between 5 and 19  years old. For the past fifteen years Alice has been selling charcoal in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  charcoal  for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more  charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Limata

texts.fr:
Limata est une femme âgée de quarante trois ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a un enfant de vingt ans qui va à l’école.
Limata travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Limata a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activté.
Dans les prochaines années, Limata voudrait augmenter son fond de roulement. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Limata is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a retiree. She has a 20-year-old child who attends school.

Limata has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells general foodstuffs in her shop for her customers. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her primary difficulty is stock shortages.

Limata has requested her second WAGES loan in order to purchase general foodstuffs. She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, Limata would like to expand her working capital. She says that with the profits, she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of three children. She has been selling fruit in an open-air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan  from  KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy fresh fruit for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit for her business

loans.name: Khardiatou Harouna

texts.fr:
Madame Khardiatou Harouna  est une dame de 41 ans, mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le cadet ,11 ans. Elle fait du commerce depuis 8 ans, en vendant des tissus spécialement un  tissu très doux appelé « Khartoum » qui  est l’habit le plus porté en Mauritanie ; c’est d’ailleurs là bas qu’elle se ravitaille.
Elle est entrée dans le commerce par hasard et aimerai développer son activité et la diversifier. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit de 150000 FCFA. Elle appui son mari dans la gestion du foyer en s’occupant des frais de scolarité de ses enfants .D ans l’avenir, elle aimerait acquérir une machine à coudre pour se lancer dans la couture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khardiatou Harouna is a 41-year-old woman, married and the mother of seven children, the eldest being 20 years old and the youngest 11. She has been in business for eight years selling fabrics, particularly a very soft fabric called "Khartoum," which is used in the outfit most commonly worn in Mauritania, which is also where she obtains her wares. 

She began this trade by chance and would like to build and diversify her business. This is why she is asking for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs.

She supports her husband in managing their home by paying her children's academic fees. In the future, she would like to get a sewing machine in order to add sewing to her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido con el objeto de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que tienen como objetivo primero poder ayudar a sus familias y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Elisa, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche por todo su barrio. Ella comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas para poder llevar su producto para la hora del desayuno. Gracias a la buena calidad de lo que vende se ha hecho de una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, con lo que podrá abastecerse y poder de esa forma tener en stock una buena cantidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Ten women in the city of Caaguazú have united with the goal of working together and, through their joint work, of getting ahead. They are very hardworking women who have as a primary objective helping their families and giving them a better lifestyle.

One of these women is Sra. Elisa who tells us that she sells milk throughout her neighborhood. She adds that she works every day from very early in the morning in order to deliver her product in time for breakfast. Thanks to the fine quality of her milk she has built up a good customer base.

She is requesting the loan to purchase milk in greater volume, so she will be able to store it and in this way have a good supply on hand. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: buy milk for later resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 32 years old and married with one child. She sells chips to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips

loans.name: Ngoitai

texts.en:
Ngoitai has been buying and selling livestock for the last 10 years in Oloitoktok town. Besides livestock she also operates a general store. She is 54 years old and married to Nalanti. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to the stock of maize flour and soft drinks in her shop which she runs alongside the livestock business.

In future, Ngoitai hopes to practice large-scale livestock farming.

loans.use: to buy two goats to rear  and also add to the stock of maize flour and soft drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 27 years old, single, and blessed with two children. Janet owns a beauty salon in Kangundo where she offers her service. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Janet is applying for her first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy weaves, a dryer and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profit to refinance the stock. 

She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dryer, weaves, and cosmetics

loans.name: Betuel

texts.es: Betuel de 38 años de edad, casado con Maximina de 36 años que fruto de este amor tienen 7 hijos, pues ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente Alta del distrito de Llochegua. Betuel es un hombre con mucho talento para la agricultura, él se inicio en esta actividad gracias a sus queridos padres hace 18 años, quienes fueron los que le inculcaron el cultivo del cacao y café. En la actualidad trabaja con su querida esposa. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos pero en temporadas de cosecha siempre cuenta con peones quienes se encargaran en agilizar la recolección de los granos de café y cacao, para luego ser secados y vendidos a los acopiadores del distrito. Él está feliz con esta labor que realiza, por que le genera un ingreso económico rentable, el único inconveniente que tiene es que en épocas de invierno la carretera es inaccesible lo que genera el incremento del costo del flete. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete unas ves más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de un terreno agrícola con cultivos de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Betuel, 38, is married to Maximina, 36, and they have seven children from this love.  They live in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.

Betuel is a man with a lot of talent for agriculture.  He began this work 18 years ago thanks to his beloved parents, who were the ones who taught him about cacao and coffee crops.  Currently he works with his beloved wife.  Generally he works with the help of his wife and children, but at harvest season he always has farmworkers who speed up the harvest of the coffee and cacao beans, to later be dried and sold to the collectors in the district. 

He is happy with this job he does because it generates a profitable income.  The only problem he has is that in the winter season the highway is inaccessible, which causes an increase in transportation costs.

This will be his second loan with MFP, for which he promises once more to make his payments punctually.

With the 2,500 PEN he will buy a plot of farmland with cacao and coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and five school-aged children. He’s doing his best to be able to offer them a respectable life. He opened his own car spare parts business in 1995, where he sells good quality items. Today, he’s looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional car spare parts for his business. He notes that this will boost his sales and allow him to earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own car show room.

loans.use: to purchase additional car spare parts for his business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, avec en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent ensemble dans le village de Bounou Markala, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de sucre, riz, cacahouète, condiments (aubergine, beurre de karité, tomates, …), articles divers de boutique (thé, bonbon, cigarette, boîtes d’allumette, …), de savon etc. 
Dans le but de satisfaire leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mama (1 ère femme sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche en position assise) est la vendeuse de sucre dans le groupe. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs de sucre. Elle se ravitaille en sucre à la foire de Konodimini, et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages environnants, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Mama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et contribuer pour les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The majority of the 10 women of the Benkadi Group are married in monogamous families; the women average 44 years of age and four children. They live together in the village of Bounou Markala in the Ségou region (4th Administrative Region of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and marriage ties.

The members of the group run a small business selling sugar, rice, ground nuts, seasonings (eggplant, shea butter, tomatoes...), various boutique goods (tea, candy, cigarettes, matchboxes...), soap, etc.

With the aim of pleasing their customers, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are taking their first group loan.

Mrs. Mama (the first woman in a seated position in the photo, from right to left) is the sugar vendor in the group. She plans to use her loan to purchase two sacks of sugar. She obtains her sugar supplies at the Konodimini market and conducts her sales from her home and throughout the surrounding villages, for cash to a group of customers made up of men and women.

With this loan, Mrs. Mama hopes to see a monthly profit of 18,000 CFA francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase sugar.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Mohamed from Goderich, western area in Freetown. He is divorced with 1 child, age 5 years. Mohamed's child attends school. 

Mohamed runs a tailoring shop at Ogoo farm. He sells male dress, female dress, stickers and traditional design cotton. He has been running this business for 15 years. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living. Before, he was doing petty trading. He works at the business, 6 days per week, 8 hours a day and has 6 employees working for him. His other source of income comes from the service of sewing. Mohamed says that the main challenges to his business are low capital and lack of collateral to access funding from financial institutions.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more sewing machines, threads, stickers, brillion and machine oil. The extra income from this loan will allow him to develop his standard of living and increase his level of income. In the future, he plans to open another tailoring shop in a different location and employ more youth. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more sewing machines, threads, stickers, brillion and machine oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 39-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.
 
She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ruth will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to rent a house and sell her clothes without walking around.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is a hardworking woman living in Hoima, Uganda. For the last 24 years, she has been farming and with the proceeds, she has been able to provide for the family. She faces the challenges of seasonal variations and inadequate funds to venture into mechanized agriculture. Her dream is to build a permanent house for her family and to expand her business to new markets. Joseline needs the loan facility to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sarongs and fabric

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale lives in Malindi, Kenya, and is married.  He has been involved in the transport industry for three years. He has a hired motorcycle.

Mangale is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his motorcycle and start a green grocery stall.  His main challenge is the overall inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

loans.use: repair his motor cycle and start a green grocery stall

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 47 years old and married with 1 child, aged 18 years.  He runs a local food store in Goderich, a western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone.

Mohamed has been in this business for 15 years and sells palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut at his store. He also earns income from his wife, who also has a small trading business.  He says that the main challenge to his business is inadequate capital to invest into his business.

Mohamed requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business and increase his standard of living. In the future, he would like to open more stores at different locations. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: buy palm oil, Gari, beans, pepper and coconut

loans.name: Filbert

texts.en: Filbert is 32 years old, married and is very hardworking.  He owns a produce buying and selling business.  He started by selling his own farm produce and after accumulating enough profits, he now buys from other farmers.  He has a challenge of inadequate capital.  His family goal is to educate his children.  He hopes to expand his business to new markets.  Filbert needs this loan facility to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is aged 36.  She has three children who all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a house builder. With this loan, she will buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profits, she wants to buy a house for residing.

loans.use: buy rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea de 57 años de edad es una mujer casada, que tiene un negocio a tevés del cual vende refrescos y también se dedica a la elaboración de bollos de mazorca: “amasijos de maíz, envueltos en hojas  de esta misma planta y amarrados con pita,   preparados con el maíz mas tierno y natural que solo Andrea conoce y le agrega queso, anís, etc. Ella con su negocio ha logrado apoyar a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos  en las edades de 36 a 44 años, quienes son profesionales exitosos.  Aunque Andrea inició con un pequeño e incipiente negocio, hoy vende en mayor cantidad  porque este ha crecido y se fortalece cada día más. En su negocio distribuye refrescos y bebidas como cervezas en grandes cantidades  a tiendas, establecimientos y vendedores de sus productos.  En la actualidad se prepara para la época de mayor movimiento comercial, “Los carnavales”, y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para surtir su negocio con gaseosas y cervezas y que sus clientes de tiendas, graneros, e independientes le compren en cantidades mayores.  Ella se está preparando  hacer su mejor venta del año.  Su meta  mas adelante es tener un estadero y mucha gente empleada,  para que también como ella,  obtengan sus ingresos con los que ha logrado el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: 57-year-old Andrea is a married woman who owns a business where she sells refreshments. She also makes corncob rolls: corn batter wrapped in leaves of the same plant, prepared with the most tender and natural corn, known only to Andrea, and mixed with cheese, aniseed, etc. Through her business she has been able to support her family, which is comprised by her husband and her five children aged 36 to 44, all accomplished professionals. Although Andrea began with a small start-up business, today she makes higher sales because the business has grown larger and stronger every day. In her business, she distributes refreshments and beverages such as beer in larger quantities to stores, businesses and people who sell her products. She's currently getting ready for her busiest time, the carnival, and she's applying for a credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will stock up her business with soft drinks and beer in order for her customers - the grocery stores and the independent ones - to buy from her in larger quantities. She's preparing herself for making her highest sales of the year.
