loans.use: To purchase an engine.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is 44 years old. She is married to Haron and blessed with four children. She has done farming for the past 11 years and gets an income of 15,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She has a good credit history with KADET  LTD. She is applying for her fourth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD; she plans to buy a dairy cow for improving her farming. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to complete her house, educate all her children to the tertiary level, improve the farming and keep high-breed cattle.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to improve her farming.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from one to four years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, sodas, loaves of bread, maize flour etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are regulars as well as walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more wheat flour and rice to sell. Eunice's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and flour to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is thirty-five years old, married to Isaac and blessed with three children aged twelve, ten and four. She sells sweet potatoes, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase sweet potatoes to sell. The profit made will help her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to live a better life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a twenty-two-year-old single man, from Gaza. On January 8th, 2011, he opened his own barber shop. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to expand the size of his shop. He believes that once he expands the size of his shop, this will bring in more customers.

loans.use: to expand the size of his shop.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married and has two children; one child is in school. 

Jacklin heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudan pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Topoika

texts.en:
Topoika is 39 years old, married and a father of six children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. 

He has applied for his third loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase inputs to prepare and cultivate his farm.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest in it. His future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs to prepare and cultivate his farm.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, a 28-year-old man from Kisumu City, situated in the Western part of Kenya, is married to Joyce, and they have a one-year-old child. For the past six years Fredrick has been operating a clothing business mainly offering men's shirts for sale, earning a monthly income of KES. 19,000.

Now requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy three bales of men's shirts, he will use the profits to grow his business. Fredrick's dream is to stabilize his income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy three bales of men's shirts for resale.

loans.name: Nelly Rogelia

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 35 años, se describe como una persona muy estricta, seria y responsable en las actividades que realiza. Nelly vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Nelly trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos blancos, es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de pollos blancos y balanceado para su alimentación, que permitirá que sus pollos engorden y que sean de buena calidad al momento de venderlos. Esta inversión permitirá a Nelly incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos que ayudaran a sustentar los gastos de su casa.

El sueño de Nelly es prosperar economicamente con su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 35-year-old woman who describes herself as a very strict, serious, and responsible person in the activities she does.  Nelly lives with her husband and three children in the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi Province.

Nelly works alone raising white chickens.  This is the first loan she is getting from FODEMI, and she will use it to buy white chickens and balanced feed for their diet, which will allow her chickens to fatten and be of good quality at the time of sale.

This investment will allow Nelly to increase her sales and her income, which will help support her household expenses.  Nelly's dream is to prosper financially with her family, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy white chickens and balanced feed to feed her animals.

loans.name: Mayamou

texts.en: Mayamou is 45 years old and lives in Jacobs Town. She is married and has four children ages 3 to 27 years old. For fifteen years now, Mayamou has been selling lappa (traditional cloth) in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because of the saving she makes  every day.  She says selling things that she likes makes her proud of her business. Mayamou is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth) for her business.  Her plans is to build a store for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth) for her business

loans.name: Mwangamgi

texts.en:
Mwangamgi is a 32-year-old married man. His wife is a farmer. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 months to 7 years. He describes himself as someone who likes sharing ideas and as a quiet man. 

He operates a general store where he sells school uniforms, wallets, radios, socks, hats, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. His business is located at an urban area, and his primary customers are passersby. 

In addition to the store, he works as a plumber to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent disturbances by the city council. 

He will use the 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase more school uniforms for selling. Mwangamgi's business goal is to venture into a new business of manufacturing items made of metal within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy additional school uniforms for selling.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a single parent with 4 children.  Efua cooks kenkey (fermented corn dough) for sale. On her lap in the picture are the leaves which she uses to cover the  maize dough in the kenkey preparation.  Efua has been in this business for 20 years. Efua will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale.

loans.use: To purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 27 years old, married, and a father of five children. He is a maize farmer and has been in the business for the last five years gaining a monthly income of  KES 17,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and this will assist him to hire a tractor for land preparation and to buy farm inputs.

Maripet hopes to use the profits to diversify into sheep farming. His future dreams is to venture into large scale farming.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for land preparation and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rahif

texts.en: Rahif is a 56-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He has big responsibilities toward his family especially his children. He has been working as a truck driver in a local company since 1995. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees. He will be more than happy to see them achieving higher positions. In the future he plans to take more Kiva loans to continue covering his children’s educational fees.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 55 and divorced. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, she has run a food stall to cover the family's living expenses. She sells beverages, cigarettes and confectionery to people in her community. The business is going smoothly, and she would like a loan to buy new furniture, coffee and beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, coffee and beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children ages 10 and 8. She has been selling fish for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000.

Lillian has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. Her increased profits will help her expand her business to other towns. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is a married man who has a three-year-old daughter. He describes himself to be a social and risk-taking man.

Mutunga operates a retail business where he sells furniture such as beds, mattresses, and chairs. He has had this business for two years, and it is located at a busy area where his primary customers are middle-income earners.

Mutunga says his biggest business challenge is not having access to enough wood. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more wood. His business goal is to expand his furniture making business and move his business to a new location within five years.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making furniture

loans.name: Tsetseg-Ulzii

texts.en:
Tsetseg-Ulzii is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her 29-year-old daughter in a ger, a Mongolian traditional felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.

Since 2006, she has been operating her own fast food service business. Her business is located in the heart of the city, so she attracts many customers. She has one employee.

Tsetseg-Ulzii is asking for a loan to renovate the outside of her fast food business.  In the future, she plans to improve her business in order to create good working conditions.

loans.use: to do some renovation work on the outside section of her fast food business

loans.name: Giao

texts.en:
Giao is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works at a private company.  She has helped support her family by making clothes for five years.

Giao plans to use the proceeds of this loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and quality of fabric and materials to make better clothes.  She hopes that this will enable her to attract new customers, increase the turnover of her business, and earn a higher income with which to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 36 years old, married, and is blessed with three children aged nine, eight, and five years old. She started a dairy farming business two years ago and now earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This 30,000 KES loan is Rachel's first, which she plans to use to purchase another cow. She wants to use the extra profit she anticipates making from the new cow to buy more chicks to rear and sell. She hopes to be prosperous in life.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Aloto Alomin 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOTO ALOMIN 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et ont des liens de parenté. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Laure est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laure est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Laure n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Laure est mariée à un certain Jules et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors des quatre enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Laure  mène comme activité la vente de céréales et de charbon de bois de façon secondaire, à son domicile. Laure achète ses produits au Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer aux dépenses du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Laure sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOTO ALOMIN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Aloto Alomin 1 Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood and share family ties. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial assistance from Alidé in order to increase their business.

The group's representative, named Laure, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Laure is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Laure is married to a man named Jules and is the mother of four children, all of them attending school. In addition to these four children, the couple is responsible for another child. The couple bears the various expenses of the family together.

For some ten years, Laure has been in business reselling grains and charcoal from her home. Laure purchases her wares in Benin. This business generates enough income to allow her to meet her needs and to contribute to the household expenses.

In the hope of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales figures and her income, Laure, along with the other members of the Aloto Alomin 1 Group, is seeking a third loan from Alidé. The two previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase grains (corn, millet) and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny is a 38-year-old lady, married and blessed with five children: Roberto, 18, Revanny, 17, attending Senior High School grades 3 and 2; Roy, 15, attending Junior High School, grade 3; Teguh, 13 and Tiar, 10 both attending elementary school. 

Henny runs a kiosk business at home. She has been running the business for four years. She sells daily basic necessities, i.e., sugar, bath soap, cooking ingredients, instant noodles, cigarettes, and some snacks. The income from her business enables her to assist her husband in covering their household needs and school fees of her children. 

Recently, Henny was thinking to improve the business. She intends to complete her kiosk business inventory with cakes, mobile phone recharges, petrol and other necessities. Henny is sure the more complete the stock at her kiosk, the more income she can earn. Therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. She is hoping that TLM will provide her with the loan shortly.

loans.use: to purchase cakes, mobile phone recharges, petrol and other necessities.

loans.name: Twisungane/ Rhng Mrm Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Rhng Mrm. Il a 42 ans et il est marié, avec 4 enfants de 6 à 16 ans  dont 3 scolarisés. Il a 6 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants pour son agriculture des tomates.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter son capital pour agrandir son projet d’agriculture en faisant l’agriculture moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le grand distributeur des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.il fait aussi l’élevage des chèvres.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the Twisungane/Rhng Mrm. Group. He is 42 years old and is married with four children, aged six to 16 years, three of whom attend school. He is responsible for six people, aside from his children. His level of education is three years of high school.

Emmanuel is a trader. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase fertilizers for his tomato crop.

His strategy for growing his business is to increase his capital in order to expand his farming enterprise by using modern farming. In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to be the major supplier of tomatoes. With the profits, he intends to send his children to school and to take care of them. He also raises goats.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his tomato crop.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 42 years old, a modest lady from Homabay town, West of Kenya. She is married to Charles and they have four children aged between 10 and 23 years.

Pamela operates a shoe selling business, a business she has been doing for the last 15 years, and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of new shoes for sale. 

She will use her profits to educate  her children and also expand business. Her dream is to have a better life now and in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of new shoes for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 52 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 24, 22, 18 and 14 years. She owns a bar and restaurant businesses she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase soft drinks and alcoholic beverages for sale. 

The profit she makes will be ploughed back into her business and apart of it used to pay school fees. Her dream is to open other branches of her business in various towns. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and alcoholic beverages for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 42-year-old lady from Homabay town, Western Kenya, and is married to Jephason. They have children aged from seven to 21 years.

Beatrice operates a beauty salon and has been doing this for the last 11 years, making a monthly income of KES 12,500. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of beauty products (cosmetics). She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to have a big beauty salon in Homabay.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cosmetics for sale in her salon

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old, married to Francis, and is blessed with two children. She sells clothes, a business she started 14 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase ladies' skirts, suits, trousers and jeans. 

Profit made will help her build more rental houses in her plot. Her dream is to become more stable in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' skirts, suits, trousers and jeans.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Emilly owns a café that has been in operation for three years. She saved the money from a casino and managed to start the business.

Emilly is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to pay for her children’s school fees.

Her future ambition is to grow the café to a better enterprise.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 32 years of age. He is married to Linet and blessed with two children, aged 6 years and 1 year respectively. He sells clothes, a business he started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to buy trousers, skirts and shirts for sale. The profit will help him buy more stock for his business. His dream is to become successful. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To buy trousers, skirts and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a fishmonger in Eguafo near Elmina. She buys the fish from the market and fries it for sale. Esi has been into this business for 15 years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to fry for sale. With the new profit, Esi wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old, a mother of five children aged 13, 10, seven, six years and seven months. She has been selling fish for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. 

The profit she makes will help her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to live a better life, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita  produces "kenkey" for sale. In front of Rita in the photo is the maize dough she uses in her "kenkey" production. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She uses her income to help her husband in the general up-keep of the family. Rita needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" production. With the new profit, Rita will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her "kenkey" (fermented maize dough) production

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Forty-eight years old, Salina is married to Nathan and is blessed with five children aged 17, 11, nine, seven and three years. She has a retail shop, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase bars of soap, packets of sugar, salt and baking flour. 

The profit earned from the business will help her expand her shop. Her dream is to expand her business, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bars of soap, packets of sugar, salt and baking flour.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, a single mother blessed with two children aged 14 and 11 years. She sells used clothes, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase bales of used clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business would help her buy a plot of land and develop it. 

Her dream is to have a better life in future. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, married to Thomas, and blessed with four children with the eldest being 18 years old and the youngest being two years old. She owns a "posho" (cornmeal) mill, a business she started 12 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to purchase bags of maize to stock in her "posho" mill. Her profit will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to be successful in her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to stock in her "posho" (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: La Sra. Zenobia  tiene 58 años y es separada con 2 hijos que son mayores ya que tienen la edad de 25 y 30 años, ella vende en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona Sopocachi. Este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la Institución,  la Sra.  Zenobia va a usar este préstamo para compra de varios productos, como  refrescos galletas  por cantidad para surtir  su negocio, y así de esta manera es incrementar su capital en las fiestas de carnavales. La Sra. Zenobia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de otras tiendas. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de  mercadería la Sra. Zenobia  sueña con  ampliar su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Zenobia, 58, is separated with two adult children, ages 25 and 30.  She sells in her neighborhood store in the Sopocachi area.

This loan is her first with the institution.  Zenobia is going to use this loan to buy large quantities of various products such as soft drinks and cookies to supply her business.  In this way she will increase her capital in the Carnival parties.  Zenobia does face challenges in her business, which is competition with other stores.  She is going to use the profits for buying merchandise.

Zenobia dreams about expanding her business.  She is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and a variety of products for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Lilian, and they two children, aged 10 and 18 years old.

Joseph has been selling clothes for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to add more stock of ladies and gents clothing, belts and traveling bags.

He will use the profits to expand his business. His dream is to supply clothing on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy ladies and gents clothing, belts and traveling bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin a construction project on her house

loans.name: Ximena Carola

texts.es: La señora Ximena vive en zona de chasquipampa  la señora se dedica a la artesanía desde hace años elabora juegos de bisutería en piedras preciosas como ser piedras cuarzo, cascajo, perlas, etc…un juego compone de cuatro piezas un collar, una manilla y un par de aretes, también da clases particulares a domicilio donde vende el material además que cobra por hora avanzada, la señora es divorciada y tiene dos hijas en edad escolar las cuales  la ayudan ya en la elaboración. Por otro lado también hace la elaboración de tortas a la semana siempre tiene por lo mínimo un pedido, el préstamo que solicita lo tiene destinado para la compra de material ya que tiene una fuerte cantidad de pedido para carnavales para un comparsa y también aumenta la demanda de pedidos en esas fechas, motivo por el cual se solicita el financiamiento Kiva.
texts.en: Ximena lives in the Chasquipampa neighborhood.  She has been working in handicrafts for years, making jewelry sets from precious stones such as pieces of quartz, stones, pearls, etc.  A set consists of 4 pieces, including: a necklace, a bracelet and a pair of earrings. In addition, she gives private lessons from her home where she sells the materials and also charges by the hour.  Ximena is divorced and has two school-aged daughters who help her make the jewelry.  In addition, she makes cakes during the week, for which she always has at least one order.  She will use this loan that she is requesting to buy supplies, because she has a large number of orders from a dance troupe that will participate in upcoming carnivals. Also, she anticipates that her orders will increase during this time, and so this is the reason that she is requesting financing from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make jewelry (stones, quartz, pearls, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Maximo

texts.es:
José  es un hombre de 58 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su albañilería.

Su historia comenzó desde pequeño su padre le enseño la actividad y asi decidió seguir con este profesión, realiza los contactos y así consigue los trabajos, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa es ama de casa y de vez en cuando vende en el mercado, si tiene hijos son mayores de edad.

Su sueño es que su familia se supere y así poderle dar un futuro bueno a ellos. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, metal.
texts.en:
José is a 58-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his building business over the next few years.

José started out in this trade when he was young and his dad taught him the business.  He decided to continue working in the profession.  He creates contacts and this is how he gets jobs.  He does not experience any difficulties.  José is married.  His wife looks after their home and occasionally sells products in the market.  They have children who are now adults.

José's dream is for his family to do well so that he can give them a good future.  He would like this loan to buy cement, sand and metal.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de mariscos. 

Su historia comenzó cuando es un negocio que viene desde el papa más de 30 años y el decidió ser independiente hace 15 años, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días el compra marisco en el puerto de santa rosa y vende en Daule, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, si tiene 4 hijos 3 estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño es entregar al por mayor el marisco a hoteles. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de mariscos como camarones, pescados, cangrejos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 35-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his seafood business over the next few years.

Luis' is a business that comes from his dad who has been in this trade for more than 30 years.  15 years ago, Luis decided to start working for himself.  He carries out his work alone every day.  He buys seafood in the port of Santa Rosa and makes his sales in Daule.  He does not experience any difficulties.  Luis is married and his wife sells clothes as an itinerant vendor.  They have four children, three of whom attend a state school.

Luis' dream is to deliver seafood to hotels wholesale.  He would like this loan for his business selling seafood such as shrimp, fish and crabs.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish and crabs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and single. She has operated her beauty salon business in Nakuru town for the last 3 years and the business is doing well.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cosmetics for use and sale in her beauty salon.

In future, Ruth hopes to grow her business and open a big cosmetics shop, hence making more profit and thereby improving her living standards.

loans.use: to add more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor  Miguel tiene 42 años de edad vive en la zona de Villa Carrasco por la carretera de Cochabamba a Santa Cruz en el municipio de Chimoré de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él es casado con la señora Leandra y tiene 4 hijos, trabaja como agricultor en su terreno agrícola más de 20 años, es un productor de arroz, yuca y algunas otras frutas que cambia según las temporadas. 
Miguel es una persona muy trabajadora y fue adquiriendo conocimientos en la agricultura desde muy joven con el paso del tiempo llego a ahorrar un dinerito que pensaba utilizar en la compra de un lote urbano para construir una casa y dejarles como herencia  a sus hijos, lastimosamente sufrió un robo en su propio domicilio, dicha situación le  desilusiono  el afán de conseguir mejores comodidades para su familia, la esposa se propuso ayudarlo y comenzó a trabajar vendiendo calle por calle  ropa nueva , al  principio las ventas fueron buenas pero su capital de operaciones fue muy reducido, es así que ahora Miguel solicita un crédito que hará que su esposa trabaje con un buen capital y de esta manera ayudar en los ingresos de la familia. Miguel dice que siempre que alguna persona pierde algo encuentra otra o tal vez otra situación que es mejor que la anterior, con el crédito que se le está otorgando la señora  Leandra podrá incrementar la venta de ropa  y así  aportar para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Miguel is 42 years old and lives in Villa Carrasco, on the road from Cochabamba to Santa Cruz, in the town of Chimoré, in the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Leandra and has four children.  He has been working as a farmer on his own land for more than 20 years.  Miguel grows rice, cassava and other fruits that change according to the season.

Miguel is a very hard-working person and he has been gaining agricultural knowledge since he was very young.  Over time, he managed to save up some money which he planned to use to buy a plot of land in the city on which to build a house to leave as an inheritance for his children.  Unfortunately, he suffered a burglary at his home.  This situation discouraged him and he lost his eagerness to achieve better comforts for his family.  His wife suggested that she would help him and started working selling new clothing from street to street.  At first sales were good but her working capital was very low.  Miguel is requesting a loan so that his wife can have good capital with which to work.  This  will enable her to contribute to the family income.  Miguel says that every time somebody loses one thing, they find another or perhaps a situation that is even better than the previous one.  This loan will enable Leandra to increase her business selling clothing and contribute toward the household expenses.

loans.use: to have working capital for his wife's business (buying clothes)

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a 30 year old man from Homabay town, West of Kenya and is married to Zipporah. They have a son who is 4 years old.

Chrispine operates a fish selling business, a business he has been doing for the last 11 years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy fish stock and iron sheets to build a food stall. He will use the profits to pay his loan.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish for sale and buy iron sheets to build a food stall.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is the woman pounding fufu. She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has been in this business for 2 years. She serves fufu, banku, and rice balls. She is married with 5 children. Ekua uses her income to support her husband and to pay their childrens' school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase  food stuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the profit, Ekua plans to upgrade her chop bar into a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase  food stuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single lady who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She owns a salon which has been in operation for the last one year. She started it off from her savings and an investment from her parents.

Grace has seen the business grow and when she heard of Milango from her friends, she decided to join in order to access credit.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a dryer, mirrors, chairs and cosmetics for the business. She will use the extra income from this loan to purchase more stock, e.g., hair food and relaxers. Grace also looks forward to opening other branches.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer, mirrors, chairs and cosmetics.

loans.name: Los Microempresarios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Microempresarios” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes  se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, corte de leña y venta de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Diana quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, de cuclillas junto a la mesa, ya que está apoyada sobre esta. Ella además usa su cabello tomado, que es de color castaño oscuro, usa uno aros color fucsia y una polera estampada con colores fucsias, negros y blancos.
Ella se dedica a la confección de vestuario y desde la fecha del último crédito su negocio ha funcionado positivamente, ya que pudo invertir en insumos para su negocio. Con ésta inversión su clientela ha aumentado considerablemente. Actualmente se encuentra al servicio de dos empresas privadas y un colegio. Lugares a los que entrega poleras, trajes de trabajo y buzos para colegio.
Como ella también se dedica a diseñar exclusivos modelos de ropa, en la actualidad también confecciona vestidos de gala en forma particular.
Respecto a su vida personal comenta que ya postuló al subsidio habitacional y que debe esperar solo 3 meses para escoger y comprar su casa propia. También comprará un auto, el cual le servirá para trasladar su mercadería. Sus metas aún siguen siendo establecerse en su negocio, para abrir una boutique de ropa. 
Diana está muy agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que continuará participando en la institución. 
Además comenta que con las capacitaciones continuas, sigue aprendiendo nuevas estrategias en ventas.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called, "Los Microempresarios", and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in various areas, including hairstyling, firewood, clothing sales, and others. All of them are from the city of Temuco. Diane is seen in the photo in the first row, crouching next to the table she is leaning on. In addition, she has dark brown hair that she wears pulled back. She is wearing fuschia-colored earrings and a printed blouse with fuschia, black and white colors.

She makes clothing, and since the date of the last loan, her business has done well, as she has been able to invest in supplies for her business. With this investment, her clientele has increased considerably. At the present time, she serves two private companies and a school. 

These are the places she delivers T-shirts, work outfits, and tracksuits for school. As she also does exclusive clothing designs, currently she also makes evening dresses for individual customers.

With respect to her personal life, she says that she has already applied for a housing subsidy, and that she must wait only three months to select and buy her own home.  She will also buy a car, which she will use to transport her merchandise. Her goal is still to establish herself in business, in order to open her own clothing boutique.

Diana is very thankful for the opportunity provided her by Fondo Esperanza. It has allowed her to continue investing in her business, so she will continue participating in the institution. In addition, she says that with the on-going training, she continues to learn new sales strategies.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region and is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). There are a series of bathing spas (Pucón, Villarrica) on lakes around the city and very striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks. It is worth emphasizing that 50% of the Mapuches, a native people of Chile, live in the area.

loans.use: To buy clothes, and fabrics and patterns in order to make new designs

loans.name: Nellys Yolanda

texts.es: Nellys de 39 años de edad, es una mujer casada que  tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años, quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando en el municipio donde habitan y ella tiene su negocio, de producción de artesanías, especialmente mochilas, bolsos y hamacas,  las cuales aprendió a elaborar por tradición cultural de su familia, para quienes el tejido vertical es su competencia mas básica y muy bien desarrollada.  En su casa su esposo que también trabaja como albañil y ella se dedican a este negocio como la mejor forma de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Los productos que mas venden son las mochilas, hamacas, en su mayoría por encargo de sus clientes, su grupo familiar también la ayuda a distribuirlas en varios municipios de la Región. Su sueño es lograr ampliar su negocio y ubicar un punto comercial  donde adicionalmente pueda ofrecer diversas mercancías como ropa y calzado que combine  con las artesanías que elabora y agregarle valor con aplicaciones hechos con sus propias manos.  En la actualidad está solicitando su credikiva, primer finaciaminto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual comprará 30 kilos de hilo, para elaborar hamacas y bolsos que han sido solicitados por sus clientes y de esta manera será exitosa porque su venta está garantizado y en manos de sus clientes mas rentables..
texts.en:
Nellys, 39, is a married woman who has three children between the ages of 12 and 17 who currently are studying in the town where they live.  She has her business making handicrafts, especially backpacks, bags, and hammocks, which she learned to make through the cultural tradition of her family, for whom vertical loom weaving is their most basic and very well developed ability.

In her home, she and her husband, who also works as a bricklayer, work in this business as the best way to generate income to support their household.  The products they sell most are backpacks and hammocks, mostly by customer request.  Her family group also helps her distribute them in various towns in the region.

Her dream is to manage to expand her business and find a commercial place where she also can offer various merchandise such as clothes and footwear that she will combine with the crafts she does, to give it value with applications made with her own hands.

Currently she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy 30 kilos of yarn to make hammocks and bags that her customers have requested.  In this way she will be successful because her sales are guaranteed and in the hands of her most profitable customers.

loans.use: to buy 30 kilos of yarn to make hammocks and bags that have been requested by customers.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodosia  tiene 45 años de edad, ella vive en Nazca, Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geoglifos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región. En su tiempo libre le gusta leer;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le guasta a Teodosia  son los riquísimos “pallares con seco, ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y tienen.							
"Teodosia se dedica al venta de abarrotes , trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias,. Y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio  por el buen servicio que ofrece y el carisma que tiene al vender.

Teodosia agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar de mercadería, con lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y así poder seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: “ Tener un negocio más grande."
texts.en:
Teodosia is 45 years old and lives in Nazca, Peru.  This city is famous for its legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, huge and inexplicable geoglyphs engraved in the desert which surrounds the city.  They are generally attributed to the Nazca people who lived in this region from 300 to 800 AD.  The city attracts a considerable number of tourists for this reason.  However, Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have survived in spite of frequent earthquakes, tsunamis and a high level of poverty in the region.

In her spare time, Teodosia enjoys reading.  As everybody knows well, Peru is noted for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Teodosia likes the most is the delicious 'pallares con seco'.  Teodosia is the mother of two children who are both now adults and have their own families.  

Teodosia's business is selling groceries.  She works around 12 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because of the good customer service that she offers and the charm that she employs when she is making her sales.

Teodosia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the support that they are giving her, she will be able to buy merchandise which means she will have a larger variety of products to sell.  This will enable her to continue working hard so that she can fulfill her biggest dream: "To have a bigger business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica  is a peddler; she sells second-hand clothes at Eguafo near Elmina which she has done for five years. She is married to a farmer and has two children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay the utility bills. Monica needs this loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Monica will acquire a shop for the sale of her second-hand clothes.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en: Maame  is a widow and has four children. She sells shea butter (a locally produced cosmetic) at Eguafo near Elmina which she has done for some time now. As a single parent she uses her income in the general upkeep of her family. Maame need this loan to purchase a large quantity of shea butter for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of shea butter for sale.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua  is a petty trader. Some of the items  she sells are tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and others. Akosua has been in this business for some time now. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

Akosua needs this loan to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items for sale. With the new profit, Akosua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years of age, married to Martha, and blessed with a six-year-old child. He sells clothes, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.  


He has requested a loan worth KES.30,000 to buy 35 leather jackets for sale. The profit will help him buy more stock for his business and repay his loan. His dream is to live a better life and expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 35 leather jackets for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old,  married to Deborah, and they are blessed with two children. Daniel is a carpenter. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.10,000 per month.


Daniel has got a good credit history in KADET LTD and he is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy raw materials like timber. He will use the extra profit to expand and to educate his children. 

He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like timber

loans.name: Noreidis Judith

texts.es: Noredis siempre tienen pedidos de sus clientes y muchas veces su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente para responderle a ellos oportunamente. Anteriormente aplicó a su primer credikiva y logró comprar materias primas e insumos con los que elaboró sus bellas artesanias, por eso su capital de trabajo aumentó ligeramnete. Como le fue muy bien con esta inversión, se arriesgó a realizar un nuevo credikiva, con este comprará hilos y aplicaciones artesanales, para producir bolsos y mochilas que le han encargado, lo cual garantiza su venta rápida y un nuevo aumento de su capital de trabajo, además de la fidelidad de sus clientes. Ella quiere enviar un mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva.   Los créditos le han servido de mucho,  con las utilidades he logrado arreglar su casa, he cambiado mi modo de vivir y he descansado de las deudas, por eso se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Noreidis always has orders from her customers, and often she does not have enough working capital to fill the orders quickly. She applied earlier for her first Kiva loan and was able to buy raw materials and supplies that she used to make her beautiful handcrafts, so her working capital increased slightly.

Since that loan went very well for her, Noreidis ventured to take out a new Kiva loan. She will use this one to buy thread and appliqués to make the bags and backpacks that have been ordered. This guarantees rapid sales and another increase in her working capital, as well as her customers' loyalty.

Noreidis wants to send a message to Kiva's lenders: "The loans have helped me a lot. With my profits, I have been able to make home repairs. I have also changed my way of life, and I've paid off my debts. I am very grateful for this."

loans.use: to buy materials to make bags and backpacks.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 30 year old married woman. She describes herself as diligent. She operates a retail business where she sells DVDs and tapes. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a busy viable area and her primary customers are frequent and walk-ins. Her biggest business challenge is the high price of compact disks. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purcase more compact disks. 

Beth's business goal and dream is to run a bigger retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more compact disks for selling.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 29 years old, married to Jackline, and is blessed with a four-year-old daughter. He has operated a cafeteria business for the last three years and earns a monthly income of KES 17,500. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase 10 bales of baking flour, six cartons of cooking fat, and a bag of sugar.

The profit he earns will assist him to educate his daughter. He hopes to lead a better life. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of baking flour, 6 cartons of cooking fat, and a bag of sugar.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a single man.  He has no children yet. He describes himself to be a principled man. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located at a busy viable area and his primary customers are frequently walk-ins. 

Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of electronics. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more electronics. Francis's dream and goal is  to run a bigger electronic shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more electronics.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 33-year-old man from Kisumu city, in the Western part of Kenya, and is married to Millicent. They have three children aged one, three and five years old.

William has been operating a motor vehicle spare parts shop for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more spare parts for sale. William will use his profits to provide for his family.

He dreams of going into the wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en: Weedor is 36 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has two children 13 and 20 years old. Both of them are in school and live at home. For the past six years she has been selling   used handbags and clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used bags and used clothes for her business. She hopes to send her children to quality schools and build her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used handbags and used clothes for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 32 year old single mother with a 1 year old daughter. She sells second hand clothes as a business she started 4 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She has requested a loan worth 20,000 KES to purchase children’s shorts, shirts, pajamas, and jumpers for sale.

The profit made will be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to become more stable in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase children’s shorts, shirts, pajamas, and jumpers.

loans.name: Estrellas Luminosa (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sector de la Sequita de la parroquia Crucita en la ciudad de Portoviejo, cada quince días se reúnen los 2 socios y las 10 socias del Banco Comunal Estrellas Luminosas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida y que con los créditos están mejorando con el pasar de los días. Este lugar está a pocos minutos del balneario de Crucita lugar de hermosas playas con una gran variedad en su gastronomía y lugares turísticos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Melida, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en el Junta Parroquial.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganar algo por su cuenta y con sus ganancias ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene una pequeña papelería en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, como su casa está muy cerca de un colegio de la localidad es por eso que tiene muy buenas ventas y también la razón por la cual hace cinco años emprendió este negocio que le ha dejado muy buenas ganancias. Ella cada cierto tiempo viaja hasta la ciudad de Manta a surtirse de productos en una distribuidora.
  
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cuadernos, libros y otros útiles escolares. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener una imprenta y copiadora para ofrecer un mejor servicio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
In the Sequita neighborhood of Crucita parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Estrellas Luminosas" meets every 15 days.  This group includes 10 women and 2 men, and they work in a variety of businesses in order to improve their quality of life.  With these loans, they are improving their businesses over time.  This place is just a few minutes away from the Crucita resort, a place with beautiful beaches, a varied cuisine, and many tourist attractions.

One of the members of this group is Melida, 52, who is married and has 4 children who are grown and independent.  Her husband works for the local government.  

Melida is a very hardworking woman who always likes to be able to earn something on her own, and with her earnings she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She has a small stationery store in her house, where she sells all types of school supplies, because her house is very close to a local school.  For this reason, she has very good sales, and it's also the reason that she started up this type of business 5 years ago.  The business has given her very good earnings.  From time to time, Melida travels to the city of Manta to stock up on products from a distributor.

Melida will use this loan to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, and she is the president of the group.  She enjoys it because of the assistance and benefits she receives from the group.

Her dream is to have a printer and copier so that she could offer more services to her community.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has six children ranging from six to fourteen years old. He describes himself to be honest and principled. He operates a service business spraying vehicles. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are frequent and walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a spraying machine. His business goal is to own a garage within five years.

loans.use: to buy a spraying machine.for washing cars

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua produces kenkey for sale (Kenkey is an African dish made out of maize).  Afua has been in this business for some time now. Afua is a widow who lives together with her three children at Eguafo  near Elmina.  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  Afua will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the production of kenkey to sell.  With the new profit, Afua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Letty

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, tiene 45 años, tiene 4 hijas de 7, 12, 23 y 24 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijas en la comunidad de Cerro Verde, Municipio de Choloma.
Doña Rosa se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de comida (pollo frito con tajadas de banano y pasteles con carne molida), dedicando 8 horas diarias de trabajo continúo. 
Ella inicio su negocio motivada por la falta de ingresos para el sustento de su familia y a la necesidad de apoyar con el estudio a sus hijas.
Doña Rosa ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para preparar sus alimentos.
Ella espera continuar apoyando a sus hijas a terminar su educación.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 45, has four daughters, ages 7, 12, 23, and 24.  She is a single mother, and she lives with her daughters in the Cerro Verde community in the Choloma municipality.

Rosa has been selling food (fried chicken with plantain slices, and ground meat pies) for three years.  She works eight straight hours a day. 

She was motivated to start her business by the lack of income to support her family and out of the necessity of educating her daughters.

Rosa has requested a loan for 6,000 lempiras to buy ingredients to prepare her food.

She hopes to continue supporting her daughters in completing their education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Roger Basilio

texts.es: El Joven Roger es cliente antiguo de Emprender trabaja con la institución hace 5 ciclos,  trabaja en una carpintería donde vende mano de obra el cobra por el numero de puertas que produce, es soltero se encuentra realizando estudios superiores en la carrera de Veterinaria, gracias al capital de trabajo que se le otorgo como préstamo el señor indica que mejoro su actividad la cual realiza con mas eficiencia, vive en la zona sud de la ciudad en casa familiar  juntamente con su madre y hermanos a los cuales coopera con los ingresos que genera, con el dinero del crédito comprara una sierra circular y herramientas que le ayudaran a realizar su trabajo, es un joven emprendedor con gana de superación se siente muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Young Roger is a long-time Emprender customer who has worked with the institution for five loan cycles. He works in a carpenter's shop where he sells his labor and charges by the number of doors he produces. Roger is single and is taking college courses to be a veterinarian. Thanks to the working capital that was lent to him, Roger says that he is able to work more efficiently

He lives in the southern end of the city, in his family's house with his mother and siblings, and gives his earnings to them. Roger will use the loan money to buy a circular saw and tools that will help him to do his work. He is an enterprising young man with a desire for self-improvement, and he is very grateful for the opportunity you offer him.

loans.use: to buy a circular saw and tools.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fishmonger in Eguafo near Elmina. She buys and smokes fresh fish from the market to sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.  Abena  is married to a farmer and has three children. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children. Abena will use her loan to purchase more fish, which she will smoke and then sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 23 years old and single. She has been selling fresh milk to her customers, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 3,500. 

She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy more fresh milk from farmers to sell to her customers. The anticipated profit will be used to buy a dairy cow. She hopes to be prosperous in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy more fresh milk to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 35-year-old married woman. She has a son who is three years old. She describes herself as determined and diligent.

For the past ten years Irene has sold cabbages, potatoes, kale, onions, tomatoes, etc. in a fast-growing urban area. Her primary customers are local residents. Insufficient funds for improving her operation is her biggest challenge.

Irene plans to use a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more vegetables to sell. Her goal is to run a bigger store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, kale, potatoes, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Norma Janeth

texts.es:
Norma Janeth tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 22,19 y 14 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en una colonia de La Lopez, Choloma, Cortes.
La actividad económica de Norma desde hace 7 años es la venta de tamales de maíz y pastelito de harina y de maíz. Los cuales vende de manera ambulante en las colonias vecinas. Inició su negocio viéndose en la necesidad de no contar con un empleo que le generara los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de sus hijos. Le dedica a su negocio 8 horas diarias.
Ella solicita su segundo préstamo con ODEF de 10,000 lempiras que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tamales y pastelitos para seguir obteniendo ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar la calidad de vida.
El plan de Norma es establecer un local estable en donde puede vender sus productos alimenticios y ya no vender de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Norma Janeth, age 38, is a single mother.  She has three children, ages 22, 19, and 14.  She lives with her children in the La Lopez settlement in Choloma, Cortes.

For seven years Norma has been selling corn tamales and flour and corn pastries.  She sells in an itinerant manner to her neighbors.  She started her business upon seeing the need to generate income to support her children.  She works eight hours a day.

She is requesting her second loan with ODEF for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to makes the tamales and pastries.  She will do this in order to continue getting income that helps her improve their quality of life.

Norma’s plan is to establish a stable place where she can sell her food products and stop selling in an itinerant manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to makes tamales and pastries.

loans.name: Herodion

texts.es:
Herodión de 42 años de edad, soltero vive en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta en el distrito de Llochegua. Herodión es un hombre ejemplar que a pesar de tener un mal que no le permite caminar, no es impedimento para realizar su trabajo. Posee un taller de carpintería donde realiza hermosos muebles, asimismo  construye viviendas de madera y lo mas increíble es que se trepa para poder clavar los listones para el techado. Nos comenta que lo hace con total normalidad, porque le encanta su trabajo y agradece a Dios por haberle dado la vida y dice que cada uno de nosotros tenemos un propósito es por ellos que estamos vivos.
Él está contento por las cosas que hace, gracias a ello puede apoyar a sus hermanos menores y sobrinos con los gastos de educación y alimentación. Por tanto será su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Herodion está feliz con su banco comunal por que son solidarios con él. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará mas madera para su trabajo de carpintería.
texts.en:
Herodión is 42 years old.  He is single and lives in his own home in Periavente Alta community, in Llochegua district.  Herodión is an exemplary man.  He has an illness that prevents him from walking but this is no obstacle to him in carrying out his work.

Herodión has a carpentry workshop where he makes beautiful pieces of furniture.  He also makes wooden houses and the most incredible thing is that he climbs up to nail the battens in place for the roofing.  He tells us that this is totally normal for him because he loves his work and he thanks God for having given him life.  He says that each and every one of us has a purpose and that is why we are here.  Herodión is happy with what he does because, as a result of his work, he is able to support his younger siblings, nieces and nephews with their educational and food expenses.

This will be Herodión's second loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He is happy with his community bank because they are supportive.  Herodión will use his 2,000 soles to buy more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: to buy more wood

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 21 year old young single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself as an optimistic. She operates a retail store where she sells phones, airtime vouchers, phones line cards, etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy phones and phone line cards. Her business goal is to open another similar retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy stock of phones and phone card for selling.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 28 year old lady from Kisumu. She is married to Francis. They have three children aged six, eight, and ten years.

Maurine operates a clothes selling business with a focus on ladies clothing. She has done this business for the last three years making a monthly income KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy ladies skirts, tops, and dresses. 

She will channel her profits to expand her clothing stock and variety. Her dream is to sell clothes in wholesale.

loans.use: To buy ladies skirts, tops, and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Nimia Hilaria

texts.es:
Nimia tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, su esposo desempeña el trabajo de motorista, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 18,16  y vive en una colonia de la Lopez, Choloma, Cortes.
Nimia se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Hace tres años ella quedo desempleada y se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos que aportara a los gastos de la familia y decidió hacer tortillas para la venta, las cuales vende en su casa. Aparte de la venta de tortillas también se dedica a vender comida los fines de semana.
Ella ha obtenido ya un préstamo con ODEF el cual le ha ayudado mucho a seguir con su negocio, actualmente solicita otro de 20,000 lempiras para comprar un estufa para su negocio.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Nimia, age 38, is married, and her husband works as a driver.  She has three children, ages 23, 18, and 16.  She lives in the La Lopez settlement in Choloma, Cortes.

Nimia sells tortillas.  Three years ago she was left without employment, and she saw the need to generate income to contribute to the family expenses.  She decided to make tortillas to sell, which she sells from her house.  Besides selling tortillas, she also sells food on the week-ends.

She has had a loan with ODEF, and it has helped her lot to continue with her business.  She is currently requesting another loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy a stove for her business.

Her goal is to continue working in order to be able to supply her family with the necessities.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 48 year old woman married to David. She is blessed with five children. 

Alice operates a animal keeping and dairy farming business. She has been in this business for the last eleven years and makes an income of KES 18,000 per month.

Alice has a good credit history with KADET. She is applying for her fifth loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy another dairy cow with the whole loan amount. 

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy another  dairy cow

loans.name: Deisy Victoria

texts.es:
Deisy vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta mucho de cocinar;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a deisy  le agrada mucho es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”, y sobre todo que le sale muy rico, es por ello que le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía porque le encanta cocinar.			
Deisy trabaja en la venta de menestras en el mercado, le dedica alrededor  8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al dia , ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y brinda una buena atención a los clientes.
 
Deisy esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podra comprar mas mercadería, lo que le permitira tener mayor variedad de productos,  así los clientes se sentirán satisfechos con los productos que ella ofrece y seguir luchando cada dia por cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Deisy lives in Ica, Perú. Ica is a city located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and Peruvians acclaim it as "La Tierra del Sol" (The Land of the Sun). It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 magnitude quake in 2007 and a 6.9 quake in 2011); for its grape, asparagus and olive production; and perhaps more than anything for being the source of Peru's traditional national drink, Pisco.

The customer's home and business can be found in this hot, dry climate. In her free time, Daisy really enjoys cooking; as many know, Peru has the most delicious food in the world. One of the dishes Deisy really likes is the very rich “arroz con pollo” (chicken with rice), and it tastes delicious when she makes it. She loves to cook, and that is why she would have liked to study culinary arts.

Deisy sells legumes at the market. She works around eight hours per day and may serve up to 30 customers per day. She believes that her business is doing well because she offers quality products and good service to her customers.
 
Deisy is very grateful to Kiva's lenders because your support has made her able to buy more merchandise, so she can have a larger variety of products. Her customers will then be satisfied with the products she offers, and she will keep striving every day to make her greatest dream come true: to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nelly Yolanda

texts.es:
Nelly es un mujer de 40 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de sastrería.

Su historia empezó desde que su mama quien le enseño desde muy joven son casi 30 años realizando la misma labor, su trabajo lo hace sola posee pequeño taller en su domicilio y el horario no está establecido afirma que cuando debe entregar alguna prenda corre hasta la madrugada, si tiene dificultades son las enfermedades, es madre soltera, si tiene hijos todos son mayores de edad.

Su sueño más importante es comprar una maquina bordadora y poder mejorar la calidad del servicio incursionar en la confección de ropa deportiva. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de sastrería comprartelas, hilos, herramientas.
texts.en:
Nelly is a woman of 40 and has many ambitions for making her sewing workshop prosper in the coming years.

Her story began when she was very young, and her mother taught her. She has been doing the same work for almost 30 years. She works on her own and has a small workshop in her home and no fixed hours. 

She says that when she has to deliver some article of clothing, she works until dawn. If she has any problem it is illnesses. She is a single mother with children who are all adults.

Her most important dream is to buy an embroidering machine; to  be able to improve the quality of her service, and get into making sports clothing. That is why she wants the loan for her sewing workshop, in order to buy fabric, thread, and implements.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and implements.

loans.name: Dionicia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Dionicia del Carmen labora como conserje en el Instituto de Seguridad Social desde hace 2 años, su compañero de vida posee su propio negocio (una Talaberteria) de los cuales obtienen otros ingresos familiares con los cuales asume los gastos de la casa; ambos son humildes y bien trabajadores,Diconica es muy querida por su   jefa y compañeros de trabajo ya que se caracteriza por ser una joven humilde, sencilla y servicial.  Solicita su primer crèdito  para comprar materiales de construcciòn y arreglar su cocina, su sueño es continuar estudiando y poco a poco ir mejorando sus condciones de vida y de su familia como toda persona lo sueña.
texts.en: Dionicia del Carmen has worked as a janitor in the Social Security Institute for the past 2 years.  Her husband runs his own business to earn money to support their family, covering household expenses.  Both of them are humble and hard-working.  Dionicia is well-loved by her boss and co-workers, and is considered a humble, simple and service-oriented young person.  She seeks a first micro-loan to buy construction materials to equip her kitchen; her dream is to continue studying and little by little improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yolanda Ines

texts.es: Yolanda es un mujer de 49 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de carbón y pollos su historia empezó con poca mercadería por motivo que su esposo falleció, su  trabajo lo hace sola desde las 6:00 hasta las 10:00, si tiene dificultades ha sido el traslado de los productos, es viuda, no tiene, su sueño más importante es seguir mejorando su casa y su negocio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de carbón y pollos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a woman of 49. She many ambitions for making her business selling charcoal and chickens prosper in the coming years. Her story began with little merchandise, because her husband passed away. 

She works on her own from 6:00am to 10:00pm. If she has a problem, it has been transporting her products.

She is a widow. Her most important dream is to continue improving her home and business. That is why she wants the loan for her charcoal and chicken business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 23 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 5 años  en la comarca Paraiso de Agua Zarca impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de la comarca  ya que es una comunidad muy alejada del municipio, pues tiene que viajar 3 horas a caballo para llegar a la colonia y despues 2 horas en camiòn para ir a la ciudad a ver a su familia 1 vez al mes. Solicita su 4to crèdito  para invertirlo en reparaciòn de la vivienda de sus padres ya que algunas paredes se encuentra en mal estado, según referencias comerciales, personales y laborales ha demostrado ser un joven responsable, honesto y muy trabajador , su sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que  su familia goze de salud y mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Adrian is 23 and for the last five years has worked as a primary school teacher in Paraiso de Agua Zarca, instructing rural children in this remote location that can be reached only by traveling 3 hours on horseback.  From there, he must travel another 2 hours by bus to the city where his family lives, and he sees his family just once a month. This is his fourth micro-loan and he plans to invest in repairing his parents' home, as its walls are in very bad condition. He is known by all in his community to be a very responsible, honest and hard-working young person.  His dream in life is to attain a stable living so that his family can enjoy better conditions and health.

loans.use: to buy land where he can build his own house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 44-year-old father of six children and husband of Kanini, has been operating his motorbike taxi business for the last six years in the town of Oloitoktok. Introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client, David is requesting his first loan to service his motorbike in order to improve service to his passengers.

In the future, David hopes to grow his business and diversify into other income-generating investments.

loans.use: to service his motorbike in order to improve his services to his passengers.

loans.name: Cony Elieth

texts.es: Cony  labora como conserje del Ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 3 años, la cual se desempeña con gran responsabilidad y honestidad,  ella es soltera, no tiene hijos ni ninguna responsabilidad econòmica por lo que su salario le alcanza perfectamente para pagar sus cuotas mensuales, ademàs  ella cuenta con la ayuda  de su mamà y de su familia ya  que  es la hija menor. Solicita su primer crèdito para construir una habitacion con mejores condiciones en la casa de su mamá. Su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando para culminar una de las metas de su vida, también su sueño es formar su propio hogar.
texts.en: Cony has worked in the Ministry of Education for the past 3 years, a job she serves in responsibly and honestly.  She is single and has no children or economic responsibilities.
